Kailas Robotics Selected for JETRO's "Global Startup Acceleration Program (GSAP)"
in the Deep Tech (IoT/Robotics/Mobility and more) Course

September 13, 2023

Kailas Robotics, headquartered in Kawaguchi City, Saitama Prefecture, is proud to announce its selection for the "Global Startup Acceleration Program (GSAP)" in the Deep Tech (IoT/Robot- ics/Mobility and others) course, an initiative by the Japan External Trade Organization (JETRO).
In collaboration with the Cabinet Office and the Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Industry, JETRO supports the global expansion of startups based in Japan's startup ecosystem hub cities. Participants in this program can anticipate gaining a broad perspective on global expansion and connections abroad through lectures by esteemed accelerator instructors, a top-tier global mentor network, and matchmak- ing with potential overseas investors and partner companies.

**Key Features of GSAP:**

1. Programs led by top-tier accelerators in regions like Silicon Valley.
* Connect with essential global networks that are challenging to access within Japan.
2. A unique program tailored for Japanese startups aiming for global expansion.
3. Choose from six courses tailored to growth stage and field.
* Specialized accelerators proficient in each domain offer the programs.
4. Achieve Product-Market Fit (PMF) in your target region and rapidly accelerate overseas expansion.
The Deep Tech course, for which our company was selected, is spearheaded by Berkeley SkyDeck, located at the University of California, Berkeley. Known for its unique fund and leveraging university resources and talent, Berkeley SkyDeck excels in supporting startups emerging from universities. Through this program, we aim to accelerate the development and enhancement of our robot arm for mobile platforms, striving for optimal market fit and market penetration.
Mr. Dambadarjaa Munkhbayar, CEO of Kailas Robotics, expressed, "It's a great honor to participate in this program. We are deeply grateful to JETRO for this opportunity. Our robot arm for mobile platforms, capa- ble of grasping objects while on the move, is characterized by its lightweight and swift operations. Con- sidering the global decline in the working population, we believe our technology will be essential in the future. Access to Berkeley SkyDeck's extensive network will undoubtedly expedite our global ambitions, and we look forward to the invaluable insights we will gain."
